title: What are the best war and history movies to watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the best war and history movies to watch? Well, with the number of movies there are, it may be a bit overwhelming trying to decide on the movie. However, I was able to receive recommendations based on consensus agreement on “best war movies”. Here is a list of the top 10 best war movies, both fiction and non-fiction, based on consensus agreement! Inglorious Bastards - “nearly show stealing” “good story”  The Pianist - “deeply affecting” “musical genius”  Schindler’s List - “humbling” “most fascinating”  Pan’s Labyrinth - “vicious” “hostile”  Saving Private Ryan - “shaky start” “very realistic acting”  Cold War - “exquisite cinematography” “lush photography”  Braveheart - “historical interest” “fierce”  War Horse - “stagey acting” “highly emotional”  American Sniper - “personal experience” “martyred character”  Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World - “realistic depiction” “for historical research”  From this great list of movies, my personal favorite would have to be The Pianist. The Pianist follows a Polish-Jewish pianist during World War 2. It highlights the Holocaust experience and provides a powerful statement on war, inhumanity and cruelty of human nature. There are countless amount of recommendations and rankings from this app called Maimovie and in general, it very much suits my taste. It continuously updates using real time user responses, and I personally think it’s much more reliable than recommendations from movie critics. Go give it a try!

I would love to write the story plot of each and every movie I've mentioned here. But the best trick is, just go through the trailer of the movie in YouTube and then decide, whether you want to watch that movie or not. That's what I do, and I hope most of us do to choose a movie. And the movies I've mentioned here are in no particular order. The king's choice 2. The man with the iron heart  3. Unbroken  4. Legends of the fall  5. Enemy at the gates  6. Pearl harbour  7.
